job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: <p><strong>Summary</strong></p><p>As a Data Scientist at Fast, you will partner closely with product managers, engineering, design, marketing, sales, or other operational leaders to define core metrics/KPIs, generate actionable data insights from large datasets, build automated dashboards using data pipelines, and run experiments to measure impact of new initiatives.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Role</strong></p><ul><li>Run complex data queries, analyze large datasets and run statistical analyses to continuously drive deeper understanding of our customers and product performance</li><li>Create dashboards and reports with effective data visualizations</li><li>Be a thought partner to business leaders in determining quantitative success and process improvement</li><li>Build data pipelines and create scripts to automate processes and reports</li><li>Build models to improve our understanding of user behavior and predict future performance&nbsp;</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Requirements</strong></p><ul><li>3+ years of experience in quantitative analysis roles</li><li>Fluent in SQL and a scripting language (R, Python)</li><li>Knowledge of experimentation and statistical methods</li><li>BS in quantitative field or equivalent experience</li><li>Skilled with Looker, Jupyter Notebook and other data visualization tools</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Nice to Have</strong></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in quantitative analysis roles</li><li>Advanced degree in quantitative field or equivalent experience</li><li>Knowledge of building data pipelines (e.g. dbt, airflow)</li><li>Experience in e-commerce industry</li><li>Previous mature startup experience</li></ul><p></p>
